intro: Rhabdadenia lindeniana, commonly known as the Lindens' rhabdadenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its succulent, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It is often found in rocky outcrops and along coastal areas, adapting to arid and semi-arid conditions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
